channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Investors pulled nearly $0.5 trillion in 2020’s market turbulence—then missed the rally
item.description: "If you buy high and sell low, your return will lag the buy-and-hold return."

item.title: Fed minutes point to ‘likely’ rate cut coming in September
item.description: The Federal Reserve on Wednesday released minutes from its July 30-31 policy meeting.

item.title: Fed meeting minutes provide latest signal that a rate cut is coming in September
Forget the 30-year mortgage: The 40-year mortgage needs to become the new American standard, former Obama advisor says
item.description: “Today, with life expectancy nearing 80 years, a 40-year term aligns better with modern realities,” Operation Hope’s founder and chief executive, John Hope Bryant, wrote.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Target, JD.com, Macy's and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

item.title: Nike’s stock tracks toward longest win streak in 17 years
AI finds a new adversary in Procreate CEO as tides shift against Silicon Valley’s latest craze
item.description: “I really f— hate generative AI," CEO James Cuda said.

item.title: Epic Systems is building more than 100 new AI features for doctors and patients. Here's what's coming
item.description: Health-care executives are visiting Epic's headquarters this week to learn about its new software products and updates.

item.title: Harris backs tax on unrealized gains — for those with $100 million in assets
Melissa Gilbert of ‘Little House on the Prairie’ fame has misophonia. What does that mean?
item.description: Yes, there's a reason you feel agitated when you hear someone chew, slurp, or tap.

item.title: This payments stock has broken out of a 2-year sideways pattern. Using options to play it
item.description: The stock finally broke out from its two-year consolidation and triggered a new bullish signal.

item.title: Did the Fed nearly lower rates in July? Meeting minutes are a half-hour away.
California braces for possible ultra-rare August snow
item.description: It would be the first in 20 years.

item.title: Nonfarm payroll growth revised down by 818,000, Labor Department says
item.description: The U.S. economy created far fewer jobs than originally reported in the 12-month period through March 2024, the Labor Department reported.

item.title: Oil prices are in retreat — and there's a payrolls-revision angle
